blog.name: one-piece-of-harry
blog.title: I AM IRON MAN
blog.description: Rachel | Cancer | INFP | CLIMATE CHANGE IS REAL. IT KILLS PEOPLE. ALL OF YOUR POLITICS SHOULD PRIORITIZE CLIMATE CHANGE | iron man stan | if you're anti-choice you're big stupid and the world would be better off without you in it

summary: Hmm a hitch stevetony au where tony is the "love doctor" who coaches men on how to grow their confidence and learn to empathise...
body: Hmm a hitch stevetony au where tony is the “love doctor” who coaches men on how to grow their confidence and learn to empathise with women and develop healthy relationships (basically queer eye but just one guy) while Steve’s the journalist who hears about some asshole getting paid to trick women into getting into bed with dishonest men. Since Steve drinks his daily “respect women” juice he resolves to hunt this guy down and write an article exposing him for the misogynist he is except oh the attractive and infuriating fella he traded a few words with at the bar the other night wants to take him out. Wellllll Steve can multitask.

dialogue.name: Tony

summary: Lunar
title: Lunar
body:
A/N: My contribution for day one of Inktober, may have forgotten to upload this yesterday. This one also includes death. This is the one that my teacher read out to the class btw, Thanks a lot Ally. This is a young Tony Stark x reader

She was standing on the rooftop of the tallest building in New York. It was the first of October 1987, it had just turned midnight. It was a full moon that night. She sat down on the edge and looked over her shoulder. Her E/C eyes reflecting the stars, “You just gonna stand there and watch or do you want to join me Mr Anthony Stark?” The young man rolled his deep dark eyes at the sound of this official title. “Maybe I like observing exquisitely beautiful moments.” The corners of her mouth twitched upwards before she burst out laughing, tilting her head back as the peals of her melodious laughter spilled through the quiet night. In the years to come, he would replay this moment in his head over and over again wondering why, why it had to be her. He stepped out of the shadows crossing the rooftop towards her, and in turn she stood up but she stood up on the ledge just when someone let off a firework. She was startled by the sudden loud bang and she slipped. Falling right off the ledge screaming. Screaming his name. Screaming for him to save her. But he was too slow. Slow from shock. Slow from fear. Slow from grief.

He vowed to never be too slow again.

October 1st 2018. Midnight. He stares the masked man in the face. He doesn’t fear the gun, he knows it’s loaded. He doesn’t close his eyes as the bullet flies towards him. As it punctures his chest, ripping the skin open, he doesn’t feel the pain, he no longer sees the man.

He sees her.
body_abstract: A/N: My contribution for day one of Inktober, may have forgotten to upload this yesterday. This one also includes death. This is the one that my teacher read out to the class btw, Thanks a lot Ally. This is a young Tony Stark x reader

summary: I hope when I have kids that Avengers has gotten so advanced and the CGI is just so beautiful. Then I show them the older...
body:
I hope when I have kids that Avengers has gotten so advanced and the CGI is just so beautiful. Then I show them the older movies, and then we get to IW and they’re crying I’ll point out “Look the CGI makes him look like he’s really stabbed!”

Ah, I’ll be a good mom

summary: Science and consequences
title: Science and consequences
body:
A/N: Hello! The god Tony was supposed to be a short story single cap but somehow it grow out thanks to the comments of the people. 

Read it on AO3

Fandom: Avengers

Summary: Bruce is close to replicate the super soldier formula but is scare of what could go wrong, a charming man stops by his office to help him out.

Warnings: None

Words: 1185

Tags: @loki-the-fox    @blackirisposts   @frostymoon11   @learisa   @cats-crows-and-cryptids   @heartbreaker6995   @lady-loki-ren   @asamandra    @snapmyneckandcallmeloki  @legendofloz

Let me know if you want to be tag :^*

***

Bruce stares at the needle in his table unsure of the next step. The military (and specially Thaddeus Ross) is putting lot of pressure on him to finish his supersoldier formula, to the point they are cutting his funds by a third and fired his lab assistant. Bruce doesn’t know how to make them understand that there are things in this world that you cannot rush. Science the first. But as the say goes: ‘Hit first, hit twice’; and they are desperate to hit first. Who or why they didn’t tell but apparently there is always a war to fight somewhere. So Bruce works extra hours; neglect his girlfriend; lives on cheap noodles on a tiny one-room apartment and basically, has a shitty life; only to give the world his formula and move on.

Problem is, he is not one hundred percent sure; the project was closed for many years and the research of Abraham Erskine and his team was not properly storage so, when they came back to it many things were missing. Including the man’s personal journal were it is said it was the complete formula. Bruce had to start almost from zero with papers wrote decades ago, mostly decomposed; written on a weird dialect half German, half English, half something else (Czech? Polish?), with almost no help. And what are his thanks? A snarky comment from General Ross about how he doesn’t tolerate failure. (Bruce would love to tell him that such an affirmation makes him a lousy scientific and for that he shouldn’t be part of the project or any other project, ever).

For the thousandth time, the good Doctor grabs the needle and puts it back on the table. If he is right, it would be his biggest achievement, maybe the biggest achievement on science since the 40s. He could even win a prize, heck, more like several prizes; it definitely would open the door to a new generation of cheaper and more effective vaccines. Maybe be the first step to eradicate all sickness in the world.

If he is wrong, shit, there are so many possibilities he just cannot pick one; it could turn people on mutated monsters, it could kill them, it could… it could…

Bruce has to stop those thoughts; he doesn’t need the images of people with third degree burns and large blisters filled with yellow fluid to add to his nightmares of everything that could go wrong. After science knows how long he finally snaps, falls on the floor on his knees and screams.

‘What I’m supposed to do? Someone, please, send me a signal and tell me what to do!’

‘Hello’

Bruce is startled, who the hell is in his laboratory? Why? The man is staring at him; waiting for a response but Doctor Banner just cannot bring the words up. He is too surprise; too exhausted; too fucked up in general to behave as a normal human being. He is dead and social interactions with him. So he points to the needle and collapse on the floor. The man sits next to him, needle on hand.

‘This tiny thing is what is causing you so much trouble?’ He asks

Bruce keeps silent, staring at the ceiling. Why he doesn’t pick the fucking needle and race to Ross?

‘I can barely imagine all the hard work you have put in this, and yet there is still a chance of failure that hunts you down.’

Bruce nods, still refusing to get out of his non verbal phase.

‘This is no easy matter for you of course, there are lives at risk. Luckily, I’m here to chase the darkness away.’

Bruce snorts.

‘Seriously, I’m here to help you to depict the consequences of your acts and to make the smartest decision.’

Bruce looks at the man for the first time. He doesn’t look military at all; messy hair, goatee, sexy smile (scratch that, no sexy smile, confident smile, smug smile but no sexy), a sock of each color and khaki pants. He looks so goofy and so charming at the same time, maybe is because he is hallucinating and trying to not to think of his sexy smile or maybe is because is the first person that seems to be genuinely  concern about his situation; but Bruce stands up and looks directly to his eyes. All the attention focused on those deep green eyes.

‘Here is the deal’ the man says looking back at him with intensity ‘I will show you the consequences of your decisions, both; taking the shot and not taking the shot and in exchange you will give me those cute glasses you are wearing. ‘

Bruce doesn’t jolt when Tony gently takes away his glasses.

‘Just like that?’ He asks in a whisper, afraid of his own voice.

‘And you will own me one.’

‘If you help me to not screw up with Ross again I will own you more than that.’

The man gives him a candid look and Bruce thinks he is going to faint.

‘Brucie dear, you got yourself a deal.’

Bruce shakes the hand of the man and a sudden blow hits him down hard. He can see it, he can’t possibly understand how but he can see it. He knows what will happen if he takes the needle to Ross and what will happen if he takes the shot. Both futures are similar and different at the same time; he sees the failure, the transformation, the fear, the chases, the run, the isolation, the fights, the war; he also sees the world, the friends, the camaraderie, the love, the redemption.  And he knows what he has to do. When he comes back from his vision the man is still there with the needle in his hand.

‘How it was?’ He asks ‘Did you got the answers you were looking for?’

‘Yes’ Bruce grabs the needle and rolls up his sleeve.

‘What are you doing?’

‘I cannot let anybody to suffer for my mistakes.’ Says Bruce with a renew confidence ‘So I have decided to embrace consequences.’

And with that he punches his arm.

***

The world is chaotic in general; Tony knows that, messy on best cases. Even with a raging green monster destroying the city the level of havoc is pretty normal for his standards. It is in the job as god of consequences, he has seen the worst of the worst; he deals with the confusion and the mayhem in all the nine realms after all. Therefore he is used to it; he knows how to ride the wave and how to predict it. Nothing, n-o-t-h-i-n-g, can surprise him anymore.  Yet, a little butterfly bats his pretty eyes and all his life turns into a fucking pandemonium. How in all the realms was he supposed to see that coming? Tony laughs at the irony.

‘Can’t wait to meet again Brucie dear and see what surprises you have in storage for me.’

With this words Tony farewells the man for now, throwing a kiss in the air; praying for the fates to be kind on him.

He knows what will happen if he takes the needle to Ross and what will happen if he takes the shot. Both futures are similar and different at the same time; he sees the failure, the transformation, the fear, the chases, the run, the isolation, the fights, the war; he also sees the world, the friends, the camaraderie, the love, the redemption.  And he knows what he has to do. When he comes back from his vision the man is still there with the needle in his hand.

‘How it was?’ He asks ‘Did you got the answers you were looking for?’

‘Yes’ Bruce grabs the needle and rolls up his sleeve.

‘What are you doing?’

‘I cannot let anybody to suffer for my mistakes.’ Says Bruce with a renew confidence ‘So I have decided to embrace consequences.’

And with that he punches his arm.

***

The world is chaotic in general; Tony knows that, messy on best cases. Even with a raging green monster destroying the city the level of havoc is pretty normal for his standards. It is in the job as god of consequences, he has seen the worst of the worst; he deals with the confusion and the mayhem in all the nine realms after all. Therefore he is used to it; he knows how to ride the wave and how to predict it. Nothing, n-o-t-h-i-n-g, can surprise him anymore.  Yet, a little butterfly bats his pretty eyes and all his life turns into a fucking pandemonium. How in all the realms was he supposed to see that coming? Tony laughs at the irony.

‘Can’t wait to meet again Brucie dear and see what surprises you have in storage for me.’

With this words Tony farewells the man for now, throwing a kiss in the air; praying for the fates to be kind on him.

trail.content_raw:
A/N: Hello! The god Tony was supposed to be a short story single cap but somehow it grow out thanks to the comments of the people. 

Read it on AO3

Fandom: Avengers

Summary: Bruce is close to replicate the super soldier formula but is scare of what could go wrong, a charming man stops by his office to help him out.

Warnings: None

Words: 1185

Tags: @loki-the-fox    @blackirisposts   @frostymoon11   @learisa   @cats-crows-and-cryptids   @heartbreaker6995   @lady-loki-ren   @asamandra    @snapmyneckandcallmeloki  @legendofloz

Let me know if you want to be tag :^*

***

Bruce stares at the needle in his table unsure of the next step. The military (and specially Thaddeus Ross) is putting lot of pressure on him to finish his supersoldier formula, to the point they are cutting his funds by a third and fired his lab assistant. Bruce doesn’t know how to make them understand that there are things in this world that you cannot rush. Science the first. But as the say goes: ‘Hit first, hit twice’; and they are desperate to hit first. Who or why they didn’t tell but apparently there is always a war to fight somewhere. So Bruce works extra hours; neglect his girlfriend; lives on cheap noodles on a tiny one-room apartment and basically, has a shitty life; only to give the world his formula and move on.

Problem is, he is not one hundred percent sure; the project was closed for many years and the research of Abraham Erskine and his team was not properly storage so, when they came back to it many things were missing. Including the man’s personal journal were it is said it was the complete formula. Bruce had to start almost from zero with papers wrote decades ago, mostly decomposed; written on a weird dialect half German, half English, half something else (Czech? Polish?), with almost no help. And what are his thanks? A snarky comment from General Ross about how he doesn’t tolerate failure. (Bruce would love to tell him that such an affirmation makes him a lousy scientific and for that he shouldn’t be part of the project or any other project, ever).

For the thousandth time, the good Doctor grabs the needle and puts it back on the table. If he is right, it would be his biggest achievement, maybe the biggest achievement on science since the 40s. He could even win a prize, heck, more like several prizes; it definitely would open the door to a new generation of cheaper and more effective vaccines. Maybe be the first step to eradicate all sickness in the world.

If he is wrong, shit, there are so many possibilities he just cannot pick one; it could turn people on mutated monsters, it could kill them, it could… it could…

Bruce has to stop those thoughts; he doesn’t need the images of people with third degree burns and large blisters filled with yellow fluid to add to his nightmares of everything that could go wrong. After science knows how long he finally snaps, falls on the floor on his knees and screams.

‘What I’m supposed to do? Someone, please, send me a signal and tell me what to do!’

‘Hello’

[[MORE]]

Bruce is startled, who the hell is in his laboratory? Why? The man is staring at him; waiting for a response but Doctor Banner just cannot bring the words up. He is too surprise; too exhausted; too fucked up in general to behave as a normal human being. He is dead and social interactions with him. So he points to the needle and collapse on the floor. The man sits next to him, needle on hand.

‘This tiny thing is what is causing you so much trouble?’ He asks

Bruce keeps silent, staring at the ceiling. Why he doesn’t pick the fucking needle and race to Ross?

‘I can barely imagine all the hard work you have put in this, and yet there is still a chance of failure that hunts you down.’

Bruce nods, still refusing to get out of his non verbal phase.

‘This is no easy matter for you of course, there are lives at risk. Luckily, I’m here to chase the darkness away.’

Bruce snorts.

‘Seriously, I’m here to help you to depict the consequences of your acts and to make the smartest decision.’

Bruce looks at the man for the first time. He doesn’t look military at all; messy hair, goatee, sexy smile (scratch that, no sexy smile, confident smile, smug smile but no sexy), a sock of each color and khaki pants. He looks so goofy and so charming at the same time, maybe is because he is hallucinating and trying to not to think of his sexy smile or maybe is because is the first person that seems to be genuinely  concern about his situation; but Bruce stands up and looks directly to his eyes. All the attention focused on those deep green eyes.

‘Here is the deal’ the man says looking back at him with intensity ‘I will show you the consequences of your decisions, both; taking the shot and not taking the shot and in exchange you will give me those cute glasses you are wearing. ‘

Bruce doesn’t jolt when Tony gently takes away his glasses.

‘Just like that?’ He asks in a whisper, afraid of his own voice.

‘And you will own me one.’

‘If you help me to not screw up with Ross again I will own you more than that.’

The man gives him a candid look and Bruce thinks he is going to faint.

‘Brucie dear, you got yourself a deal.’

Bruce shakes the hand of the man and a sudden blow hits him down hard. He can see it, he can’t possibly understand how but he can see it. He knows what will happen if he takes the needle to Ross and what will happen if he takes the shot. Both futures are similar and different at the same time; he sees the failure, the transformation, the fear, the chases, the run, the isolation, the fights, the war; he also sees the world, the friends, the camaraderie, the love, the redemption.  And he knows what he has to do. When he comes back from his vision the man is still there with the needle in his hand.

‘How it was?’ He asks ‘Did you got the answers you were looking for?’

‘Yes’ Bruce grabs the needle and rolls up his sleeve.

‘What are you doing?’

‘I cannot let anybody to suffer for my mistakes.’ Says Bruce with a renew confidence ‘So I have decided to embrace consequences.’

And with that he punches his arm.

***

The world is chaotic in general; Tony knows that, messy on best cases. Even with a raging green monster destroying the city the level of havoc is pretty normal for his standards. It is in the job as god of consequences, he has seen the worst of the worst; he deals with the confusion and the mayhem in all the nine realms after all. Therefore he is used to it; he knows how to ride the wave and how to predict it. Nothing, n-o-t-h-i-n-g, can surprise him anymore.  Yet, a little butterfly bats his pretty eyes and all his life turns into a fucking pandemonium. How in all the realms was he supposed to see that coming? Tony laughs at the irony.

‘Can’t wait to meet again Brucie dear and see what surprises you have in storage for me.’

With this words Tony farewells the man for now, throwing a kiss in the air; praying for the fates to be kind on him.

summary: Another take on Steve and Tony’s view on the Accords: Both of them are trying to do the right thing and make the Avengers...
body:
Another take on Steve and Tony’s view on the Accords:

Both of them are trying to do the right thing and make the Avengers accountable for their actions, but the way they want to do so is shaped by their pasts. 

Steve’s greatest betrayals have come from organisations. The Army abandoned Bucky and the 107th when they were captured. SHIELD turned out to be just a front for HYDRA. He can only rely on himself, and individuals as they prove themselves to him.

Tony’s greatest betrayals have come from the people closest to him. Everything with Stane. Rhodey stealing the suit. Himself with Ultron. He prefers to rely on the structure of organisations, where there is a system of checks and balances to mitigate damages caused by an individual.

Both approaches have their strengths and weaknesses, and both are valid. Each of them are trying to guard against the situations that hurt them in the past.

summary: Avengers on Twitter
title: Avengers on Twitter
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xUnCxL

by mcu_webhead

Iron Man @OfficialTonyStark
Why is Clint singing Christmas carols while belly dancing? Or why Steve and Bucky are screaming “medium rare vines” at each other? And hOLY SHIT BRUCE JUST HULKED OUT

or

The Avengers have Twitter. It turns out as well as you’d suspect.

or

Domestic Avengers + Twitter = madness

Words: 136, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man - All Media Types, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: General Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: Multi

by IchBinEs

After the Avengers split into “Team Iron Man” and “Team Captain America” and the connection between these two teams abruptly stopped, a new power saw the chance to seriously threaten the world. The captain’s team tries to prevent the danger, but they can only do it with the help of the others.

blog.name: myshittyironmansideblog
blog.title: a recovering alcoholic reads iron man comics
blog.description:
instead of yelling at my poor boyfriend im going to yell into the void 
| 26 years old | trans guy | ben |
i only use the mobile app so im sorry if everything is a mess. 
my main blog is @icouldreallyuseanewurl

tags: it just kills me so much
ive mentioned how i (used to) drink to cope with chronic pain
the other day i was having a horrible pain day and i was laying on the sofa in agony and i could only think about going to the store
i didn't but god that's all i thought about that day
at least it distracted me from how much pain i was in ashdkdkfh
i just love tony stark so much
summary:
Tony's hallucinations are of him from different stages of his alcoholic past:
of him drunk and dressed as doctor doom:
And of,...
body:
Tony’s hallucinations are of him from different stages of his alcoholic past:

of him drunk and dressed as doctor doom:

And of, what I think is one of the biggest causes of his alcoholism, his shitty dad:

There’s more than this and it just kills me. He’s trying to save the Earth; there should be so much on his mind to distract him, but the damn urge to drink never goes away. It overrides everything else.

Iron Man: Fatal Frontier #12
